nodes.label: Photosynthesis
nodes.description: The process by which green plants and some other organisms convert light energy into chemical energy, forming sugars.

nodes.label: Traditional PAR Range
nodes.description: The spectral range of 400–700 nm, historically defined as Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR), but now recognized to overlook far-red photon contributions.

nodes.label: Far-Red Photons (701–750 nm)
nodes.description: Photons with wavelengths between 701 and 750 nm, shown to be efficiently utilized in photosynthesis, particularly in shaded environments.

nodes.label: Leaf Gross Photosynthesis
nodes.description: The total rate of carbon fixation by a leaf, before accounting for respiration.

nodes.label: Sunlit Conditions
nodes.description: Environmental conditions characterized by high incident light intensity, such as full sun exposure.

nodes.label: Deep Shade Conditions
nodes.description: Environmental conditions characterized by low incident light intensity, often found in dense canopies or understory environments.

nodes.label: Photosystem I (PSI)
nodes.description: One of the two photosystems in plant thylakoid membranes, preferentially excited by longer-wavelength (far-red) photons.

nodes.label: Photosystem II (PSII)
nodes.description: One of the two photosystems in plant thylakoid membranes, primarily excited by shorter-wavelength photons, with its efficiency enhanced by far-red synergy.

nodes.label: Shorter-Wavelength Photons (<700 nm)
nodes.description: Photons within the traditional PAR range, primarily responsible for exciting Photosystem II.

nodes.label: Synergistic Interactions
nodes.description: A process where the combined effect of far-red and shorter-wavelength photons on photosynthesis is greater than the sum of their individual effects.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Efficiency
nodes.description: The effectiveness with which plants convert light energy into chemical energy, significantly improved by far-red photon utilization.

nodes.label: Current Photosynthesis Models
nodes.description: Computational frameworks used to simulate photosynthetic processes, which typically exclude photons above 700 nm.

nodes.label: Current Photosynthesis Measurements
nodes.description: Experimental techniques used to quantify photosynthetic rates, which commonly exclude photons above 700 nm.

nodes.label: Plant Productivity
nodes.description: The rate at which plants accumulate biomass, directly influenced by the accuracy of photosynthesis assessment.

nodes.label: Global Carbon Cycle
nodes.description: The biogeochemical cycle of carbon exchange among Earth's major reservoirs, heavily influenced by plant photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Climate Change Impacts
nodes.description: The effects on global climate systems, where accurate understanding of carbon cycling through photosynthesis is crucial.

nodes.label: Definition of PAR
nodes.description: The established scientific boundary for Photosynthetically Active Radiation, which needs revision to include far-red wavelengths.

nodes.label: Incident Photons in Shade
nodes.description: The total number of photons reaching a plant in shaded environments, where far-red photons can constitute over 50%.

nodes.label: PSII Efficiency
nodes.description: The quantum efficiency of Photosystem II, which is enhanced by synergistic interactions with far-red photons.

nodes.label: Canopy and Shade Environments
nodes.description: Specific microenvironments within plant communities where light quality, particularly far-red proportion, is significantly altered.
